meanings.definition: A beat or throb, as of the heart or blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: The doctor listened to the pulsation of my heart with a stethoscope.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the pulsation of my heart when I was nervous.
meanings.sent3: The pulsation of the heart can be heard in a quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The pulsation of the blood vessels is like a gentle drumbeat in the body.
meanings.sent5: Her hand on my chest felt the pulsation of my heart, steady and strong.

meanings.sent1: The pulsation of the music made me want to dance.
meanings.sent2: The pulsation of the drum created a lively rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The pulsation of the speaker was so loud it made the walls shake.
meanings.sent4: The pulsation of the earthquake was felt throughout the city.
meanings.sent5: The pulsation of the waves against the shore was calming and soothing.

meanings.definition: A single vibration or short burst of sound.
meanings.sent1: The sudden pulsation of the alarm startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: I heard a pulsation in the distance, like a quick tap on a drum.
meanings.sent3: The pulsation of the doorbell made the dog bark excitedly.
meanings.sent4: The pulsation of the fireworks lit up the night sky with bursts of color.
meanings.sent5: A pulsation of thunder echoed through the valley, followed by a flash of lightning.
